title: Identify the Purpose
text: A scatterplot is used to visualize data involving two variables.

title: Focus on Relationships
text: Scatterplots help in identifying patterns or relationships between two quantitative variables.

title: Quantitative Variables
text: Scatterplots are specifically used for quantitative data, not categorical data.

title: Visualizing Correlations
text: Scatterplots can show correlations, trends, or clusters between two variables.

hintAnswer: To display the relationship between two quantitative variables.
title: Select the Correct Purpose
text: The primary purpose of a scatterplot is to display the relationship between two quantitative variables.
choices: To show the distribution of a single variable.
To display the relationship between two quantitative variables.
To compare the means of different groups.
